name: Tree Tutor for Tots
overview: Tree Tutor for Tots is an educational math game for the Commodore 64. You have the option to see the apples in the trees the whole time, or to only see the apples if you guess wrong. Every time you answer correctly, a bird takes an apple from the tree and put it in a basket. The game was developed as a type-in game by Janet Arnold and published in COMPUTE!'s Gazette 1984/03 (Issue #09). A version of the game was also released for the VIC-20 in the same magazine.
